definitions.definition: something that blocks a road, passage, entrance, etc. so that nothing can go along it, or the act of blocking something in this way:
examples: There's some kind of obstruction on the railway tracks.

definitions.definition: behaviour or actions that prevent something from happening or working correctly:
examples: They were charged with obstruction of the police/of justice (= preventing the police/law courts from doing their jobs).

definitions.definition: in sport an occasion when one player gets in the way of another and so prevents them from moving freely:
examples: The referee said it was obstruction.
